original_title: Weeks after reports that Meta was offering $100 million signing bonuses to poach OpenAI talent, it turns out the social media giant's chatbot ambitions aren't panning out so well - as the company has frozen hiring in its artificial intelligence division  — The Donald
article_summary: Meta has frozen hiring in its AI division due to challenges in developing chatbots, as highlighted by the underperformance of their chatbot ambitions. The discussion on Reddit suggests that AI is only as good as the bias of its developers and is not actual intelligence, but a powerful tool for automating tasks.</s>
